title: 2025 F1 British GP schedule, India timings
description: Up next on the 2025 F1 calendar is the British GP at Silverstone – the track which hosted the very first F1 World Championship race 75 years ago. Will McLaren continue its dominant run or will Silverstone serve up a surprise winner? Silverstone will also kick off the second half of the F2 championship. German touring car series DTM (Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters), meanwhile, returns for Round 4 at Norisring. Here’s your complete guide for when and where to tune in from India: 2025 F1 British GP schedule Armed with fresh updates, McLaren absolutely dominated at the last race in Austria. The scorching hot conditions played to the team’s strengths, but weather forecasts predict mixed conditions for the British GP with potential rain. Ferrari will be hoping to take the fight to McLaren though, specially with home hero Lewis Hamilton chasing his first Ferrari podium. The Italian squad finished P3 and P4 in the Austrian GP after introducing a new floor upgrade. Silverstone will show us whether this was just a one-off or if the team has genuinely taken a step ahead. Of course, both Mercedes and Red Bull will also be looking to bounce back after a difficult Austrian GP. Oscar Piastri still leads the standings, 15 points ahead of his teammate Lando Norris. Reigning F1 champion Max Verstappen is third overall, but he’s now 61 points off the lead. Richard Verschoor currently leads the championship by 24 points from Alex Dunne. It’s also a big weekend for Arvid Lindblad. The 17-year-old was granted an early Super Licence and will be making his F1 debut this weekend, driving Yuki Tsunoda’s RB21 in Friday’s FP1. Mercedes driver Lucas Auer is currently leading the standings, 16 points ahead of Schubert motorsport BMW’s Rene Rast. The championship also has Indian representation with Arjun Maini racing a Ford Mustang GT3 this year for the Haupt Racing Team. After picking up six points at the last round, he’s moved up to P17 in the standings. html:
Silverstone also kicks off the second half of the 2025 F2 season, while DTM heads to the Norisring street circuit.

Up next on the 2025 F1 calendar is the British GP at Silverstone – the track which hosted the very first F1 World Championship race 75 years ago. Will McLaren continue its dominant run or will Silverstone serve up a surprise winner?

Silverstone will also kick off the second half of the F2 championship. German touring car series DTM (Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters), meanwhile, returns for Round 4 at Norisring. Here’s your complete guide for when and where to tune in from India:

2025 F1 British GP schedule

Armed with fresh updates, McLaren absolutely dominated at the last race in Austria. The scorching hot conditions played to the team’s strengths, but weather forecasts predict mixed conditions for the British GP with potential rain.

Ferrari will be hoping to take the fight to McLaren though, specially with home hero Lewis Hamilton chasing his first Ferrari podium. The Italian squad finished P3 and P4 in the Austrian GP after introducing a new floor upgrade. Silverstone will show us whether this was just a one-off or if the team has genuinely taken a step ahead.

Of course, both Mercedes and Red Bull will also be looking to bounce back after a difficult Austrian GP. Oscar Piastri still leads the standings, 15 points ahead of his teammate Lando Norris. Reigning F1 champion Max Verstappen is third overall, but he’s now 61 points off the lead.

Where to watch:

All F1 British GP sessions will be streamed live on the Fancode and F1 TV apps.

2025 F1 British GP India timings
DateDaySessionTime (IST)
July 4FridayFP15pm
July 4FridayFP28:30pm
July 5SaturdayFP34pm
July 5SaturdayQualifying7:30pm
July 6SundayRace7:30pm

2025 F2 British GP India timings

It’s a closely fought battle for this year’s F2 crown with just 31 points separating the top five drivers. Richard Verschoor currently leads the championship by 24 points from Alex Dunne.

It’s also a big weekend for Arvid Lindblad. The 17-year-old was granted an early Super Licence and will be making his F1 debut this weekend, driving Yuki Tsunoda’s RB21 in Friday’s FP1.

Where to watch:

All F2 Austrian GP sessions will be streamed live on the Fancode and F1 TV apps.

July 4FridayQualifying7:25pm

DTM Norisring

Norisring is the only street circuit on the DTM calendar, and at 2.3km, it’s also the shortest circuit on the calendar. Mercedes driver Lucas Auer is currently leading the standings, 16 points ahead of Schubert motorsport BMW’s Rene Rast.

The championship also has Indian representation with Arjun Maini racing a Ford Mustang GT3 this year for the Haupt Racing Team. After picking up six points at the last round, he’s moved up to P17 in the standings.

Where to watch:

All DTM Norisring sessions will be streamed live on Fancode.
